meanings.definition: The quality or state of being toilsome.
meanings.sent1: Her toilsomenesses in the garden showed her dedication to growing beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent2: The toilsomenesses of his job as a construction worker left him exhausted at the end of each day.
meanings.sent3: Despite the toilsomenesses of cleaning the house, she always found a way to make it fun by listening to music.
meanings.sent4: The toilsomenesses of studying for the exam felt like climbing a steep mountain.
meanings.sent5: The toilsomenesses of the journey through the dense forest made it a challenging but rewarding experience.

meanings.definition: The condition of involving hard work or labor.
meanings.sent1: The toilsomenesses of farming required early mornings and long days in the fields.
meanings.sent2: His toilsomenesses in fixing the broken fence paid off when it stood strong against the wind.
meanings.sent3: The toilsomenesses of baking a cake from scratch made her appreciate store-bought desserts more.
meanings.sent4: The toilsomenesses of building a house from the ground up was a true test of his skills.
meanings.sent5: The toilsomenesses of running a marathon pushed her to her limits but also brought a sense of accomplishment.
